meanings.sent1: The undoer quickly fixed the mistake.
meanings.sent2: She is known as the undoer of all errors.
meanings.sent3: The undoer accidentally made things worse instead of better.
meanings.sent4: He was like an undoer of knots, always finding a way to unravel problems.
meanings.sent5: The undoer's presence brought a sense of relief to the team.

meanings.definition: Something that undoes or reverses an action.
meanings.sent1: The magic potion acted as the ultimate undoer of spells.
meanings.sent2: Pressing the red button was the undoer of all progress.
meanings.sent3: The undoer of time turned out to be a simple hourglass.
meanings.sent4: The key was the undoer of the locked door, granting access to the treasure.
meanings.sent5: The undoer of fate was a mysterious artifact hidden in the ancient ruins.
